replies.author: albertwang-ibm

prb112

timeline.bodyText: what does setPageNum 2 mean?
timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText:
paging is used for the common implementation. e.g, for patient export, the codes read page of patients, and then write these patients' resources of current to-be-exported resource type to COS, and then move to the next page of patients.
But for group export, we don't really use paging for patients, we get all patient in one batch, so just as mentioned in the comments, we simply set current page number to be 2 and the lastpagenum to be 1 to simply sign the CheckPoint and ChunkWriter to finish writing for current resource type.
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

replies.bodyText: OK - I got it now.  Thanks.
replies.author: prb112

timeline.bodyText: ? gets replaced?
timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: yes, ? will be replace with the group id
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

timeline.bodyText: camelcase and visibility modifier?
timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: good catch.
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

timeline.bodyText: we run these on each Integration test?
timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: I didn't add ExportOperationTest to server integration test testng.xml, so it doesn't run in the pipeline now.  I prefer to run this in local integration test at present.  but let me add it to the pipeline, because seems the deployment/configurations are ready in the pipeline, so, let me try to enable it now and let's see what we can get...
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

replies.bodyText: en, it failed in the pipeline, because there is unfinished db2 javabatch config in server.xml, let me remove it from server.xml.
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

replies.bodyText:
interesting, got ClassNotFound error, seems cause by the removing of databaseutil in the dependency. let me sync with master and test in my local to find out if I can reproduce this...
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/ibm/fhir/database/utils/api/IDatabaseTarget com.ibm.jbatch.container.controller.impl.ChunkStepControllerImpl
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

replies.bodyText: en... does reproduced in my local the same error ... trying to figure out how this can happen ...
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

replies.bodyText: fixed the error by adding databaseUtil to bulkdata webapp war, and removed the export test from testng.xml of integration test because it needs COS key and service id to be configured correctly.
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: avoiding getBytes each time?
replies.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: I didn't because I thought the cost is very minor, but make sense for me to make the change.
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: this is a refactor, will change in eclipse and commit.
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

timeline.bodyText: shouldn't this throw a more specific exception?  more easily differentiating in code downstream?
timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: not needed, the job always exit when this rare error happens, exception info in log is enough
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: I used HashSet on purpose here, didn't want this to be generic, it's for internally used only.
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

timeline.bodyText: I think we should throw an exception.  This could lead to unintended consequences.  if a tenant is not passed in, it should be treated as invalid.
timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: the control should be in the operation side, the javabatch itself allows non tenant id to make the javabatch Job test itself easier.
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: Signed-off-by: Albert Wang xuwang@us.ibm.com
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

timeline.bodyText: maybe add a logger.fine for debug purposes?
timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: also chunkData.getBufferStream() <-- who is response to close this?
replies.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: haha, good question. Actually Closing a ByteArrayOutputStream has no effect per java document, actually the function is empty in codes. it's handled by garbage collector after no reference to it.  and the same ByteArrayOutputStream is used the whole life circle of the batch job.
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

replies.bodyText: OK, I think adding a comment to that effect is good thing in the code.
replies.author: prb112
